result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek Edwin Cloud was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023.

miscConds.notes:
- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.
- Court set restitution at $0.
- AS TO ALL COUNTS: Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation on count 1.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.  If defendant is revoked, pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges (including the DV and DNA surcharge) and assessments which are to be collected by DOC at a rate which the department deems reasonable from the defendant's funds and during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
- Court orders any bail on deposit to be returned to the person who posted it, and NOT applied to the court costs.
- Defendant advised that as a convicted felon s/he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also s/he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

- No use of possession of firearms.
- No contact with victim until defendant has started batters intervention.

- Complete a batters intervention program at the Alma Center.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Comply with any recommended treatment of the agent.
- Provide a DNA sample by 5pm on 10/21/2022.

- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random UAs.

Defendant Derek Edwin Cloud in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Derek Edwin Cloud.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 5 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of  2 and 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of *2 and 1/2 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence.

AS TO COUNT 5: Defendant ordered to serve 41 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 41 DAYS time served, THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  

AS TO COUNT 6: Defendant ordered to serve 42 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 42 DAYS time served, THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  

AS TO COUNT 1: Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- AS TO COUNT 1: Serve 30 days condition time, stayed at the discretion of the agent.
- Report for probation by 5pm on 10/21/2022.
- Complete a batters intervention program at the Alma Center.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Comply with any recommended treatment of the agent.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random UAs.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- No contact with victim until defendant has started batters intervention.
- Full time work.
- Provide a DNA sample by 5pm on 10/21/2022.
- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.
- Court set restitution at $0. 

- AS TO ALL COUNTS: Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation on count 1.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.  If defendant is revoked, pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges (including the DV and DNA surcharge) and assessments which are to be collected by DOC at a rate which the department deems reasonable from the defendant's funds and during extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

- Court orders any bail on deposit to be returned to the person who posted it, and NOT applied to the court costs.

Defendant advised that as a convicted felon s/he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also s/he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been restored.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

Received and Filed. Defendant's Custody Credit
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Derek Edwin Cloud in court.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Derek Edwin Cloud.  Attorney Elaine B. Fehrs in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Sentencing Hearing.  Defense counsel requests adjourned sentencing hearing.  State does not object.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Derek Edwin Cloud in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Joshua Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for jury trial. Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing held.  
  
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNTS 1, 5, & 6.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders COUNTS 2, 3, 4, & 7 DISMISSED and READ-IN for sentencing purposes.

Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court orders current terms and conditions of bail to continue pending sentencing hearing. Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing IN PERSON. Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Jury Instructions for Defendant's Plea, filed.
Defendant's Plea Questionnaire/Plea Advisement Form, filed.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Defendant Derek Edwin Cloud in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Elaine B. Fehrs appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pretrial conference. Court conducts final pretrial conference with counsel off the record.  Court places status on the record. Case remains calendared for jury trial on 6/21/2022 at 9:00 am in Br. 35.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Attorney Fred Richardson in court, defendant Derek Edwin Cloud not in court, in custody.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Court hears arguments as to bail. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court modifies bail to $2,500.00 CASH. All other previously ordered terms and conditions of bail to continue. Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar. Any pretrial motions to be filed a week before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned to Branch 35.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 35:
Defendant Derek Edwin Cloud in court with Attorney Fred Richardson; both appear by video.  Defendant Derek Edwin Cloud in custody.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of Dane County cases 21CF2666 & 21CF1346. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Roembke. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 35.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
